titles.title: Expressing the sense of the Congress with respect to funding for the Uruguay Round of GATT negotiations.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Trade.

bill.summary: 8/17/1994--Introduced. Expresses the sense of the Congress that: (1) trade agreements which promote free trade by reducing trade barriers are free in that they do not exact a cost on U.S. taxpayers by reducing net Federal revenues; and (2) budget rules which inaccurately calculate the revenue impact of trade agreements by ignoring the U.S. growth caused by tariff changes in other countries should not be applied to the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade implementing legislation in a way that requires increased taxes or program reductions to "offset" expected tariff revenue reductions.
